RationalPiano.Input
Class InputMidi

java.lang.Object
  RationalPiano.Input.InputMidi

public class InputMidi
extends java.lang.Object

Receives Midi Notes and CC Messages for Sustain. Translates presses to newVoice() and noteOn() and releases to releaseVoice() and noteOff().

Version:
1.0
Author:
Fabian Ehrentraud
Licence:
Licensed under the Open Software License (OSL 3.0)
Date:
2010-09-24

Constructor Detail

InputMidi

public InputMidi(processing.core.PApplet papplet,
                 IVoices voices,
                 INoteOutput noteoutput,
                 java.lang.String midiInputDevice)
Initializes the MIDI Input with the given MIDI device.

Parameters:
papplet - The processing applet.
voices - A Voices object for creating new voices and removing old ones.
noteoutput - The NoteOutput object to send note on/off messages to.
midiInputDevice - The partial and case-insensitive name of the MIDI Input device which should get opened.
Method Detail

noteOnReceived

public void noteOnReceived(rwmidi.Note note)
Handles incoming Note On messages. Translates these calls to according method calls in the IVoices and INoteOutput objects.

Parameters:
note - The received Note On message.

noteOffReceived

public void noteOffReceived(rwmidi.Note note)
Handles incoming Note Off messages. Translates these calls to according method calls in the IVoices and INoteOutput objects.

Parameters:
note - The received Note Off message.

controllerChangeReceived

public void controllerChangeReceived(rwmidi.Controller controller)
Handles incoming CC messages. Only pays attention to Sustain (damper) messages which are CC64 and forwards them to the IVoices and INoteOutput objects.

Parameters:
controller - The received CC message.

programChangeReceived

public void programChangeReceived(rwmidi.ProgramChange programchange)
Handles incoming Program Change messages, in this case ignore them.

Parameters:
programchange - The received Program Change message.

sysexReceived

public void sysexReceived(rwmidi.SysexMessage sysexmessage)
Handles incoming Sysex messages, in this case ignore them.

Parameters:
sysexmessage - The received Sysex message.
